conclusion: Analyze forces on the copper rod in the magnetic field, considering initial and final tension states.
Copper rod MN with mass m and length L is suspended by two wires in a magnetic field B, perpendicular to the paper.
Initially, tension in wires is T, balanced by magnetic force F, so T = F.
When energized, tension decreases to 1/4 T, magnetic force remains F, so F = 1/4 T.
Magnetic force on current-carrying rod is F = iB, so iB = 1/4 T.
Initial tension T equals rod's weight mg, so iB = 1/4 mg.
Using right-hand rule, current flows from M to N for upward magnetic force.
Magnitude of current is mg/(4B), direction is from M to N.
